title.narrative: 002 IMPROVE DIETS THROUGH LIFECYCLE

description.narrative: By 2025, caregivers of early and middle-childhood, adolescents and pregnant/lactating women increase their demand for and have access to improved quality of nutrition services and diets to prevent chronic malnutrition, which contributes to Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, chronic malnutrition (stunting) and wasting in children is reduced including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, caregivers of early and middle-childhood, adolescents and pregnant/lactating women increase their demand for and haveaccess to improved quality of nutrition services and diets to prevent chronic malnutrition

description.narrative: With;an average daily food expenditure of ETB 28 (60 Cents USD) for the most impoverished households of five people in Amhara and the cost of a nutritious option reaching towards ETB 77, accessibility and affordability of nutrient-dense foods represent significant bottlenecks. Therefore, UNICEF has focused on: i) Mobilizing developing partnerships to develop affordable nutritious solutions, ii) Assessing context- specific multisectoral approaches; iii) Gauging the voice of children on their aspirations; iv) Continuing ongoing efforts with health workers and religious leaders. An assessment of the practices in refugee camps was implemented and results will be available in Q1 of 2022. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
